column2: HAWAII DMV WRITTEN TEST
column6: HI

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Bicyclists must:
column4: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column6: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.
column8: remain near the left edge of the road.
column10: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column6: Hairpin corner ahead.
column8: Right turns not allowed.

column2: 3. Which statement about motorcycles is true?
column4: Motorcyclists are less vulnerable to injury than a car  driver if involved in an accident.
column6: It is generally easier to judge a motorcycle’s distance and speed.
column8: The small profile of the motorcycle may make it appear closer and travelling faster than it actually is.
column10: Motorcycles are allowed the full width of a lane in which to maneuver.

column2: 4. You are driving up a hill and are approaching a heavy truck from the rear. You should know that:
column4: you may not be able to safely pass the truck.
column6: the truck may be traveling at a speed slower than the posted speed limit.
column8: you may not be able to legally pass the truck.

column2: 5. Before turning, you should:
column6: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.
column8: increase your speed.

column2: 6. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column6: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column8: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.

column2: 7. If one of your tires blows out while driving, you should:
column6: apply the brakes firmly and steer toward the right edge of the road.
column8: hold the steering wheel firmly, slow down, and steer smoothly.
column10: hold the steering wheel tightly and shift into neutral to bring the front of the vehicle back in line.

column2: 8. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.
column6: you cannot change lanes.
column8: you cannot pass.

column2: 9. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
column6: green, yellow and red.
column8: green, red and yellow.

column2: 10. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
11. A pedestrian starts to cross in front of your vehicle. You should:
column6: speed up and pass in front of the pedestrian.
column8: stop until the person is out of the crosswalk.
column10: sound your horn and proceed with caution.

column2: 12. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column6: turn off the ignition.
column8: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column10: prepare to leave the lane safely.

column2: 13. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column6: less dangerous
column8: darker

column2: 14. This traffic sign warns you about:
column6: an intersection ahead.
column8: a winding road.
column10: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.

column2: 15. When a stop is required at an intersection with no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: Drivers should stop at the point nearest the intersecting roadway where the driver has a view of approaching traffic on the intersecting roadway before actually entering the roadway.
column6: Drivers are not required to stop.
column8: Drivers are required to slow down to make sure crossing traffic is clear.
column10: Drivers should stop only at a place where the driver can see at least 100 feet on either side.

column2: 16. An aggressive driver:
column6: weaves in and out of traffic.
column8: shows little or no respect for traffic laws.

column2: 17. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column6: you must turn right.
column8: there’s a narrow bridge ahead.

column2: 18. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.
column6: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column8: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column10: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.

column2: 19. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
column6: that a divided highway ends
column8: of two-way traffic

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column6: Divided highway
column8: Yield

column2: 21. To keep your vehicle from rolling into traffic when parked on a hill, if you are facing uphill you should:
column4: turn the back wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column6: set the parking brake and keep the front wheels straight.
column8: turn the front wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column10: turn the front wheels away from the curb or edge of the road.

column2: 22. This warning sign means:
column4: Watch out for children crossing the street
column6: Slow down, drive with caution and watch for children
column8: You are approaching a school

column2: 23. When parked facing down hill, your wheels should be turned:
column6: toward the curb.
column8: parallel to the curb.

column2: 24. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column6: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.

column2: 25. This sign tells drivers that:
column6: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
column8: they must not make a right turn.

column2: 26. When you are driving on the roadway and hear a siren behind you, you should:
column4: pull over to the side and stop.
column6: slow down and drive with caution.
column8: speed up to get out of the way.
column10: immediately come to a complete stop.

column2: 27. This sign warns drivers that:
column6: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.
column8: U-turns are now allowed.

column2: 28. When riding in a vehicle, small children:
column4: must never be allowed to ride in someone's lap or standing on a seat.
column6: may not wear safety belts if an adult is sitting next to them.
column8: are allowed to stand on the floor in the back of the vehicle.
column10: may not wear safety belts when sitting in the backseat.

column2: 29. When you see a “reduced speed ahead” sign, you as a driver should know:
column4: that you should maintain your vehicle’s speed till you get to the slower speed zone.
column6: that the sign is only there for poke-along drivers.
column8: that you should begin to reduce your vehicle’s speed.
column10: that it's dangerous to slow down because traffic starts to back up.

column2: 30. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column6: Only if the light is green.
column8: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
